title: Listen to Model/Actriz’s New Song “Diva”
description: The third single from the New York band’s new album Pirouette
author: Walden Green
excerpt: The third single from the New York band’s new album Pirouette
text: The third single from the New York band’s new album PirouetteModel/Actriz have shared a new song. “Diva” is the third taste of the New York band’s forthcoming new album, Pirouette, following “Doves” and lead single “Cinderella.” Listen to it below.“The song takes place on a date, and the song references many of the real ones I’ve been on while on tour,” Model/Actriz frontman Cole Haden said of “Diva” in a press statement. “Specifically, I’m remembering the times where frivolity shifted to mourning as we both realized we may never see each other again once the night is over. What I’ve learned is that in order to be ‘that bitch,’ one must make use of the melancholia.”Pirouette, the follow-up to Model/Actriz’s 2023 debut, Dogsbody, is out on May 2. Revisit the interview “For Post-Punks Model/Actriz, Confrontation Is an Opportunity for Intimacy.”Walden Green is a music writer and cultural critic who joined Pitchfork in 2024. A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, his work has appeared in Dirt, The Fader, and Philadelphia. He lives in New York. ... Read more
html:
The third single from the New York band’s new album Pirouette

Model/Actriz have shared a new song. “Diva” is the third taste of the New York band’s forthcoming new album, Pirouette, following “Doves” and lead single “Cinderella.” Listen to it below.

“The song takes place on a date, and the song references many of the real ones I’ve been on while on tour,” Model/Actriz frontman Cole Haden said of “Diva” in a press statement. “Specifically, I’m remembering the times where frivolity shifted to mourning as we both realized we may never see each other again once the night is over. What I’ve learned is that in order to be ‘that bitch,’ one must make use of the melancholia.”

Pirouette, the follow-up to Model/Actriz’s 2023 debut, Dogsbody, is out on May 2. Revisit the interview “For Post-Punks Model/Actriz, Confrontation Is an Opportunity for Intimacy.”

Walden Green is a music writer and cultural critic who joined Pitchfork in 2024. A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania, his work has appeared in Dirt, The Fader, and Philadelphia. He lives in New York. ... Read more
